arts.ttl: Supercomputer predicts Premier League title race after Arsenal slip up against Aston Villa
arts.sum: A supercomputer predicts the winners of the Premier League title after Arsenal's draw with Aston Villa.

arts.ttl: Arsenal's draw with Aston Villa highlighted one glaringly obvious flaw that WILL cost Gunners the Premier League title, writes DANNY MURPHY - and it's NOT their lack of a top striker
arts.sum: DANNY MURPHY: The tension even filtered its way to Mikel Arteta who has been less excitable on the touchline in general this season but reverted to type as his side lost their way at the Emirates.

arts.ttl: William Saliba injury update: Mikel Arteta reveals next steps as defender misses Aston Villa draw
arts.sum: Mikel Arteta provides an injury update on Arsenal centre-back William Saliba, who was absent for his side's 2-2 draw with Aston Villa on Saturday evening.

arts.ttl: Arsenal misfit told he's 'lost the crowd' after display in Aston Villa draw
arts.sum: Arsenal threw away a two-goal lead against Aston Villa on Saturday, denting their Premier League title hopes and seeing star Raheem Sterling come in for more criticism

arts.ttl: Mikel Arteta admits 'something is missing' in Arsenal's attack as he bemoans Gunner stars for letting two-goal lead slip against Aston Villa
arts.sum: ISAAN KHAN AT THE EMIRATES: Mikel Arteta admitted 'something is missing' in his Arsenal team as they blew a two-goal lead to draw against Aston Villa on Saturday evening.

arts.ttl: Mikel Arteta makes feelings clear in pointed message to Arsenal chiefs after Aston Villa blow
arts.sum: Arsenal's lack of squad depth was exposed as Aston Villa came from 2-0 down to draw in the Premier League on Saturday against an injury-depleted side at the Emirates Stadium

arts.ttl: Louie Barry fits the Celtic mould of fan favourite as Aston Villa insider delivers glowing reference
arts.sum: The 21-year-old is on Brendan Rodgers' wishlist as he looks to add to his ranks in this window

arts.ttl: Amadou Onana injury update as Unai Emery confirms fresh Aston Villa blow
arts.sum: Amadou Onana suffered a suspected hamstring injury in Aston Villa's 2-2 draw against Arsenal. After full-time, Unai Emery was asked about Onana's injury and said: "I don’t know exactly.

arts.ttl: Arsenal star CALLED OUT over Aston Villa error: That can’t win you league titles!
arts.sum: Arsenal star Thomas Partey has been called out a crucial error during the Gunners’ 2-2 draw with Aston Villa – a result that sees Mikel Arteta’s side lose more valuable ground on Liverpool in the Premier League title race. Arsenal star CALLED OUT over Aston Villa error: That can’t win you league titles!

arts.ttl: Emery praises Villa's resilience in Arsenal draw
arts.sum: Fixtures Arsenal Vs. Aston Villa - Sat, Jan 18th 2025, 17:30 Unai Emery was proud of Aston Villa’s attitude after his side came from two goals down to draw with Arsenal in the Premier League on Saturday evening. The visitors were on the back foot at 2-0 down as the match reached the hour mark, but they responded with two goals in eight minutes to turn the game around. Villa also held firm in the final few minutes, putting their bodies on the line to earn a draw at Emirates Stadium. “We showed resilience, we showed mentality today,” Emery said. “In 90 minutes, we struggled sometimes when they were dominating the match. “In some moments we needed to be defensively strong and we needed the goalkeeper, but we had our moments to control the game with the ball, to get into their box and to be close to scoring a goal. “At 2-0, it was very difficult. We never gave up and never thought that it was impossible. We were speaking before the match and at half-time about being resilient and that if we could score one goal we’d have possibilities. “We showed this mentality, achieved one goal and continued to try to push for the draw.” Youri Tielemans got the comeback started with a superb diving header before Ollie Watkins netted in North London again, turning home Matty Cash’s cross. Both sides had chances to win the match, and Emery was pleased that his side kept pushing after levelling the scores. He said: “After it went to 2-2, the mentality was the same: try to defend, try to get our moments and to score the third goal. “They created two very good chances and one at the end with Trossard, and they had some action in our box, but we also had shots from Youri and Lamare with the possibility to score.”
